subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: I would also like jdk 1.4 support for Junt4.x. If TestNG could do it, I don t see why JUnit team should not do it. Simply follow what TestNG has done -
messageBody:
I would also like jdk 1.4 support for Junt4.x. If TestNG could do it, I
don't see why JUnit team should not do it. Simply follow what TestNG has
done -> http://testng.org/doc/documentation-main.html#jdk-14.

This will really help teams which for a long time will be forced to use 1.4.

Is there an existing bug for this where we can vote for this feature
addition?

--Vishal

Mark Levison wrote:

>Kent (and other JUnit 4 developers) – has any consideration been given to
>support Java 1.4 with JUnit 4.xx. The use of annotations – could be replaced
>with doc comments. Unfortunately some of us work in corporate environments
>where use of Java 1.5 will take at least another couple of years (we only
>just dropped support for Java 1.3). Can you for see support for Java 1.4 are
>must we look to TestNG to fulfill our needs?
>Thanks
>Mark Levison
>----------------------------------------------------------------------
>Blog: http://www.notesfromatooluser.com/
